subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|⿵[[門]][[巿]]}} (with {{l|mul|巿}} - 4 strokes instead of {{l|mul|市}} - 5 strokes) - As found in {{l|mul|𩦔}} (U+29994), not to be confused with {{l|mul|𩦴}} (U+299B4) which contains {{l|mul|市}} instead. * Note that the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} used in Japan and Korea as well as the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}} uses a vertical dot for the upper component of [[亠#Translingual|亠]] which is slightly different from modern Chinese scripts which uses a slanting {{l|mul|丶}} dot for the upper component of [[亠#Translingual|亠]] in {{l|mul|市}}.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=169|rad=門|as=05|sn=13|four=77227|canj=ANYLB|ids=⿵門市}} <!-- Note: ⿵門巿 is incorrect and is not used in Japan or Korea. 亠 and 巾 is separated not combined together. If you zoom into the Unicode charts at 500% the serif hook is visible at the top right corner of 巾. -->

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|[[𠿷]]([[𭈥]]), [[𢷃]]([[𫽔]]), [[𣿸]], [[𤐛]]([[𬊢]]), [[𫆺]], [[𮬔]]}} * {{l|mul|𩦴}} (U+299B4, contains {{l|mul|⿵[[門]][[市]]}}) and {{l|mul|𩦔}} (U+29994, contains {{l|mul|⿵[[門]][[巿]]}})
